benchmark_config.jira_title: Implement/Test API: POST /1.0/kb/accounts/{accountId}/block - Block an account

covered: POST/Valid Payload: Multiple success paths with minimal and full inputs (TC01–TC05) returning 201 and JSON array of BlockingState.
Optional inputs: requestedDate and pluginProperty combinations, including empty array and extra params handling (TC02–TC04, TC15, TC18).
Headers: Required X-Killbill-CreatedBy present/missing, optional Reason/Comment used (TC01–TC02, TC08).
Validation: Invalid accountId format and injection attempts (TC07, TC13), malformed/missing body (TC09–TC10), malicious payload blocked (TC14).
Non-existing resource: 404 when account not found (TC06).
Server error handling: 503 for DB outage and plugin outage (TC12, TC22).
Large payloads: Near-maximum payload successfully processed (TC20).
Performance/resilience: Concurrency, sustained load, and downstream slowness within limits (TC19, TC25–TC26).
Plugin interactions: Happy path and failure when plugin is unavailable (TC21–TC22).
gaps: Duplicate submission behavior is not covered (same request sent twice) to verify idempotency or duplicate detection semantics.
requestedDate validation gaps: invalid formats (e.g., 2024-13-01), out-of-range dates, and timezone handling not tested.
BlockingState schema negative tests: missing required fields, invalid enum values, unexpected fields, and type mismatches are not exercised.
pluginProperty validation gaps: wrong types (string instead of array), illegal characters/lengths, duplicate keys/values, and multi-parameter encoding not tested.
Server error 500 path not covered; only 503 scenarios are tested. Need generic unhandled error case and standard error body validation.
Authorization 403 (authenticated but not permitted) not covered.
Response headers not asserted: no checks for Content-Type application/json (and charset) per produces clause, nor consistent error response structure.
Concurrency on the same account not tested (simultaneous blocks to one account to detect race conditions/order).
Audit metadata behavior (Reason/Comment propagation to audit logs or response metadata) not verified.
Input size boundary negatives: exceeding maximum field lengths and payload size should return 400/413, only max-allowed success is tested.
recommendations: Add a duplicate submission scenario: send the identical POST twice and verify expected behavior (second call 200/409/no-op vs duplicate row).
Add requestedDate negative tests: invalid format ('07/01/2024'), invalid date ('2024-02-30'), timezone offsets, past vs future semantics, and boundary at 00:00Z.
Create BlockingState schema-negative cases: missing required fields, invalid enum/state transitions, wrong data types, unexpected additional fields -> expect 400 with clear errors.
Add pluginProperty validation tests: single string (not array) -> 400, extremely long values -> 400, duplicates collapsed/allowed, URL-encoded multi parameters, illegal characters handling.
Introduce a forced 500 Internal Server Error path (e.g., null pointer/unknown exception via test harness) and assert status and standardized error body.
Add a 403 Forbidden scenario for an authenticated user lacking permission to block accounts.
Assert response headers: Content-Type application/json on 201 and error responses; ensure bodies match documented error schema.
Test concurrent blocks on the same account (N simultaneous POSTs) to verify correctness of resulting BlockingState set and absence of race-induced duplicates.
Verify audit propagation: X-Killbill-Reason and X-Killbill-Comment are captured in audit logs/metadata and optionally reflected in response if applicable.
Add input size negative tests: fields exceeding max lengths and payload > max limit -> expect 400/413 with appropriate error messaging.
